title: Calories in a Crunchwrap Supreme
meta_description: Discover calories in a crunchwrap supreme from Taco Bell, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, sodium, and quick tweaks for variations.
assumptions: Standard Taco Bell beef Crunchwrap Supreme with seasoned beef, nacho cheese, lettuce, tomatoes, sour cream, and tostada shell; as served.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, customizations, portion size, and preparation; values based on standard menu item. Check Taco Bell app or labels for latest.

quick_answer.text: A standard Crunchwrap Supreme provides ~530 kcal, 16 g protein, and high sodium.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with fast-food packaging.

tweaks.label: Chicken version (substitute beef for grilled chicken)
Fresca style (no creamy sauces, add pico de gallo)

faqs.q: How many calories in a crunchwrap supreme?
faqs.a: Approximately 530 kcal for the standard beef version.

faqs.q: What's the protein in a Crunchwrap Supreme?
faqs.a: About 16 g of protein per serving.

faqs.q: Is the Crunchwrap Supreme high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 1300 mg sodium, which is over half the daily recommended limit.

faqs.q: How many carbs in a crunchwrap supreme?
faqs.a: Roughly 65 g total carbs, including 7 g fiber.

faqs.q: Does customizing a Crunchwrap Supreme change calories?
faqs.a: Yes—swapping proteins or adding toppings like cheese can add or subtract 20–100 kcal.
